analyzed: snying rje dang snying rje chen po gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /

original: smras pa rnam pa brgyad yod de //
analyzed: smras pa rnam pa brgyad yod de //
translated: It is said that there are eight differences:

original: ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang sa dang / rgyud dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang / mi mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pa'i thugs rje 'byung ba dang / skyob pa dang / mi skyob pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang sa dang / rgyud dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang / mi mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pa'i thugs rje 'byung ba dang / skyob pa dang / mi skyob pa'o //
translated: protection, and nonprotection.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is nonaversion and nondelusion.

original: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang gsum la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang gsum la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its aspect is the aspect of suffering, because it arises in the three realms.

original: dmigs pa ni khams gcig dang gsum la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni khams gcig dang gsum la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object is one realm and three realms.

original: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its level is the four meditations and the fourth meditation.

original: rgyud ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its continuum is the continuum of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i thob pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i thob pa ni /
translated: Its freedom from attachment is freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is attained through freedom from attachment to the desire realm and the peak of existence.

original: mi mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pas thugs rje 'byung ba dang / yongs su skyob pa dang / yongs su mi skyob pa'o //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pas thugs rje 'byung ba dang / yongs su skyob pa dang / yongs su mi skyob pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-equality and equality is due to the arising of compassion, complete protection, and non-protection.

original: mi bzad pa nyid du phun sum tshogs pa ni skye ba dang / shi ba dang / na ba dang / mya ngan dang / zad pa dang bral zhing 'jig rten gyi mthar phyin pa yang dag par thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi bzad pa nyid du phun sum tshogs pa ni skye ba dang / shi ba dang / na ba dang / mya ngan dang / zad pa dang bral zhing 'jig rten gyi mthar phyin pa yang dag par thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of the unsurpassable is due to the attainment of the end of the world, free from birth, death, sickness, sorrow, and destruction.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means attaining the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder.

original: mtshungs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sems thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sems thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of the unequaled is due to being the highest of all minds.

original: chos thams cad la dbang thob pa'i phyir bzhed pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang thob pa'i phyir bzhed pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he has obtained mastery over all dharmas, he has actualized all the qualities that are connected with his mere wish. This is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúhe has actualized all the qualities.

original: ci sangs rgyas thams cad yon tan 'di dag thams cad bye brag med par mnga' 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci sangs rgyas thams cad yon tan 'di dag thams cad bye brag med par mnga' 'am zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Are all the Buddhas equal with regard to all these qualities?

original: ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: ma yin te / 'on kyang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
translated: No, they are not.üîΩHowever,üîΩall the Buddhas are equal in three ways:üîΩin their accumulation of the equipment, in their Dharma Body,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam nyid de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam nyid de //
translated: and in their work for the sake of beings.üîΩThey are not equal in their life span,

original: tshe dang rigs rus tshad kyis min //
analyzed: tshe dang rigs rus tshad kyis min //
translated: in their caste, in their clan, in their physical size,üîΩin their faculties,üîΩor in their enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: rgyu gsum gyis mnyam ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis mnyam ste /
translated: They are equal in three ways:üîΩin their accumulation of the equipment of merit and knowledge in the past,

original: sngon bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag pa thob pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod pas so //
analyzed: sngon bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag pa thob pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod pas so //
translated: in their perfection of the Dharma Body, and in their work for the sake of beings.

original: sku tshe dang / rigs dang / rus dang / tshad kyi bye brag yod de /
analyzed: sku tshe dang / rigs dang / rus dang / tshad kyi bye brag yod de /
translated: They are not equal in their life span, in their caste, in their clan, in their physical size,üîΩin their faculties, or in their enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: yun ring po dang thung dur 'tsho ba dang / rgyal rigs dang / @226b bram ze'i rigs kyi bye brag dang / 'od srungs dang goo ta ma la sogs pa'i dus kyi bye brag dang / chen po dang chung du'i bye brag ni dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yun ring po dang thung dur 'tsho ba dang / rgyal rigs dang / @226b bram ze'i rigs kyi bye brag dang / 'od srungs dang goo ta ma la sogs pa'i dus kyi bye brag dang / chen po dang chung du'i bye brag ni dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The differences in duration of life, in the distinction of the warrior class and the priestly class, in the various periods of time such as the period of the luminous beings and the period of the sons of Vivasvan, and in the differences of the great and the small eons are in accordance with the differences in time.

original: de dag mi'i zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde la rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa ni gang /
analyzed: de dag mi'i zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa'o // de la rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa ni gang /
translated: The word human refers to those who have the power of the cause and those who have the power of the condition.üîΩWhat is the power of the cause?

original: rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the power of the condition?

original: gang dag dge ba'i stobs bskyed pa las nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las rab tu skyed pa de dag ni rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i stobs bskyed pa las nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las rab tu skyed pa de dag ni rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those who are born from the power of the cause are those who are born from the power of the cause of the internal proper mental attention that is generated from the power of the wholesome.

original: gang dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las chos bstan pa thob pa de dag ni rkyen gyi stobs dag ldan pa yin no ;
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las chos bstan pa thob pa de dag ni rkyen gyi stobs dag ldan pa yin no ;
translated: Those who are born from the power of the condition are those who obtain the teaching of the Dharma from the power of the condition of the spiritual benefactors.

original: ; de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: ; de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúThere are two causes and two conditions for the arising of right view:

original: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / gzhan gyis bsten pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / gzhan gyis bsten pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: the internal proper mental attention and the external reliance on the scriptures of the Great Vehicle.

original: rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: ‚Äú Gain‚Äù refers to the four kinds of gain:

original: bsod nams rnyed pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po rnyed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa dang / rnam par dag pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams rnyed pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po rnyed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa dang / rnam par dag pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: gain of merit, gain of the vast joy of service, gain of concentration, and gain of purification.

original: de la bsod nams rnyed pas ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'jig rten pha rol gyi mkho ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams rnyed pas ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'jig rten pha rol gyi mkho ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'o //
translated: By the gain of merit, one obtains all the perfections of the aims of one‚Äôs next life, just as one wishes.

original: mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa dag gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa phun sum tshogs ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rnyed pa dag gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa phun sum tshogs ba thob pa'o //
translated: By the gain of the vast joy of service and the gain of concentration, one obtains the perfection of the happiness of the present life.

original: rnam par dag pa rnyed pas ni sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du zad pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnyed pas ni sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du zad pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: By attaining purity, one attains the perfection of the complete destruction of all suffering.

original: gang dag chos la zhes bya ba ni chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang dag chos la zhes bya ba ni chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Those who have faith in the Dharma, etc. The Dharma is threefold:

original: 'bras bu'i chos dang / bsgrub ba'i chos dang / bshad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos dang / bsgrub ba'i chos dang / bshad pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma as result, the Dharma as practice, and the Dharma as teaching.

original: de la 'bras bu'i don gyi chos ni 'bras bu'i chos te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i don gyi chos ni 'bras bu'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma as result is the Dharma that is the result,

original: gang ma skyes pa dang / ma gyur pa dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / zhi ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa dang / ma gyur pa dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / zhi ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: which is called nirvana, that is, the unarisen, the unmanifest, the uncreated, the uncompounded, the unoriginated, the peaceful, and the excellent.

original: de la ma skyes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'brel pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ma skyes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'brel pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the unarisen is because it is not associated with the connection of the appropriation of the aggregates.

original: ma gyur pa ni bdag gi dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa mngal dang / byis pa dang / dar la bab pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i ngo bos je che je cher skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma gyur pa ni bdag gi dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa mngal dang / byis pa dang / dar la bab pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i ngo bos je che je cher skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The unborn is not the self because it does not have the nature of growing larger and larger through the stages of embryo, infant, youth, adult, and elder.

original: gyur pa ni rgas pa la bya'o //üîΩma byas pa ni @227a * //
analyzed: gyur pa ni rgas pa la bya'o // ma byas pa ni @227a * //
translated: The born is the aged.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i shugs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i shugs dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncreated is not the self because it does not have the nature of the karma and afflictions of the past.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unconditioned is not the self because it does not have the nature of the present karma and afflictions.

original: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'byung ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'byung ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unarisen is not the self because it does not have the nature of the arising of future birth.

original: zhi ba ni sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa gtan du zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa gtan du zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The peaceful is not the self because it is the complete pacification of suffering and its cause.

original: gnas ni de las ma nyams pa yin no //üîΩbsgrub pa'i chos ni bsgrub pa'i chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: gnas ni de las ma nyams pa yin no // bsgrub pa'i chos ni bsgrub pa'i chos nyid yin la /
translated: The abiding is not the self because it does not have the nature of the present body.üîΩThe established is not the self because it does not have the nature of the established.

original: de yang 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la bya ste /
translated: The established is the nature of the established, and that is the eightfold noble path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: bsgrub pa 'dis ji skad du bstan pa'i slob ma rnams 'bras bu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: bsgrub pa 'dis ji skad du bstan pa'i slob ma rnams 'bras bu rtogs par byed de /
translated: By this practice, the disciples realize the result as it has been taught.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag yin te ;
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag yin te ;
translated: Among them, right view is the branch of complete discernment,

original: des ji ltar myong ba de kho na nges par 'dzin to //
analyzed: des ji ltar myong ba de kho na nges par 'dzin to //
translated: because by it one holds fast to just that which is experienced.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag yin te /
translated: Right thought is the branch of causing others to understand,

original: des ji ltar khong du chud pa yid la bzhag nas ngag kun du sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: des ji ltar khong du chud pa yid la bzhag nas ngag kun du sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: because by it, having taken to mind what one has understood, one purifies one's speech.

original: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag yin te /
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the branches of causing others to have confidence,üîΩbecause by them one causes others to have confidence in the path.

original: de rnams kyis go rims bzhin khong du chud na lta ba la sogs pa rnam par dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis go rims bzhin khong du chud na lta ba la sogs pa rnam par dag par yid ches so //
translated: If one understands these in order, one has confidence in the purity of view, etc.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ni khong du chud pa dang mthun par dris pas lung bstan pa la 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas lta ba rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ni khong du chud pa dang mthun par dris pas lung bstan pa la 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas lta ba rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that the purity of view is due to the ascertainment of the scriptural doctrine by means of the correct expression, which is the question and answer that accords with understanding.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa la sogs pa la spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa la sogs pa la spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
translated: One should understand that the purity of morality is due to the perfection of the practice of engagement and disengagement, etc. , which is the correct action.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnang ba bzhin chos kyis chos gos la sogs pa chol ba las 'tsho ba rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnang ba bzhin chos kyis chos gos la sogs pa chol ba las 'tsho ba rnam par dag par rig par byed do //
translated: One should understand that the purity of livelihood is due to the correct livelihood, which is the livelihood by means of the Dharma, such as the robes, etc. , in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The correct exertion is the member that purifies the obscurations of the defilements.

original: des kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spong bar byed do //
analyzed: des kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spong bar byed do //
translated: By means of that, one abandons all the fetters without exception.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag yin te /
translated: Right mindfulness is the branch of purification of the obscurations of the secondary afflictions.

original: dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas @227b nas mtshan ma la rmongs pa med pas zhum pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skabs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas @227b nas mtshan ma la rmongs pa med pas zhum pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skabs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, when mindfulness is well established, one is not confused about the signs of the object, and so one does not provide an opportunity for the secondary affliction of discouragement.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par spyod ba'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par spyod ba'i yan lag yin te /
translated: Right concentration is the branch of purification of the obscurations of the special qualities.

original: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub cing mjug tu yang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub cing mjug tu yang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
translated: Because it accomplishes the special qualities such as the superknowledges and finally it causes the attainment of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: langs pa'i tshe ni yan lag 'di dag rung na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa na yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: langs pa'i tshe ni yan lag 'di dag rung na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa na yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag mi 'byung ste /
translated: When one has arisen from that, these branches are suitable. But when one enters the path and is equipoised, right speech, right action, and right livelihood do not occur.

original: de kho na nyid nges par gzung ba la sogs pa yang med na lam la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe bsgrub pa'i yan lag brgyad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na nyid nges par gzung ba la sogs pa yang med na lam la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe bsgrub pa'i yan lag brgyad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the ascertainment of reality and so on do not exist, then how could the eight branches of the path of preparation exist at the time of entering meditative equipoise on the path?

original: bshad pa / de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dmigs pa las de'i ngo bo zag pa med cing rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dmigs pa las de'i ngo bo zag pa med cing rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
translated: Response: When one attains the supramundane state that focuses on the object, its nature is uncontaminated and one attains nonindicative form.

original: gang thob ba las langs pa'i tshe yang log pa'i dag la sogs pa la mi 'jug gi yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: gang thob ba las langs pa'i tshe yang log pa'i dag la sogs pa la mi 'jug gi yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug go //
translated: When one arises from that attainment, one does not engage in wrong speech and so on but engages in right speech and so on.

original: de bas na rgyu dang rgyu can nye bar gdags pa las yan lag brgyad nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: de la cha ba ni khrus dang / bsku ba dang / phyi bdar byed pa'o//
analyzed: de la cha ba ni khrus dang / bsku ba dang / phyi bdar byed pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúTo anoint‚Äù means to wash, to rub in, and to wipe.

original: brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang phreng ba la sogs pas rgyan byed pa yin te /
analyzed: brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang phreng ba la sogs pas rgyan byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúTo adorn‚Äù means to adorn with clothes, garlands, and so on.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pas zas za ba 'gog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pas zas za ba 'gog par mdzad do //
translated: He stops eating with the thought that he will do this.

original: ci tsam du de'i lus nyid gnas pa dang / 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog gi rgyun kho na'i phyir dang / stobs kyi rgyun kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci tsam du de'i lus nyid gnas pa dang / 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog gi rgyun kho na'i phyir dang / stobs kyi rgyun kho na'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúTo the extent that his body is maintained and lives‚Äù means only for the duration of his life and only for the duration of his strength.

original: srog ni tshe gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni tshe gnas pa'o //
translated: Life is the duration of life.

original: stobs ni 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: stobs ni 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Strength is living.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lte ba'i mig bsku ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lte ba'i mig bsku ba lta bur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that‚Äù means like the axle hole of a chariot.

original: bkres pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ltogs pa'i sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i don to /
analyzed: bkres pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ltogs pa'i sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i don to /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout hunger‚Äù means the opposite of the suffering of hunger.

original: ji ltar rma gso bar bya ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rma gso bar bya ba lta bur ro //
translated: Like healing a wound.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang / lus la gdung ba med pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i don te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa dang / lus kyi stobs dang / lus la gdung ba med pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i don te /
translated: In order to benefit those who are celibate means in order to accomplish the noble path in dependence on the maintenance of the body, the strength of the body, and the absence of torment of the body.

original: tshangs par spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is celibacy?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the noble path with eight members, as stated in the sutra.

original: 'di ltar sngon gyi tshor ba spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang bkres pa las byung ba'o //üîΩtshor ba gsar pa bskyed par mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon gyi tshor ba spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang bkres pa las byung ba'o // tshor ba gsar pa bskyed par mi bya ste //
translated: Thus, one should abandon the former feeling means the feeling that arises from hunger.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang mang ba las byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang mang ba las byung ba ste /
translated: One should not generate a new feeling means the feeling that arises from overeating.

original: 'dis nyung ba dang / lhag pa'i kha zas spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis nyung ba dang / lhag pa'i kha zas spong bar byed do //
translated: By this, one abandons the avoidance of little food and the indulgence in excessive food.

original: 'di ltar zhes smos pa ni tshod rig pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos pa ni tshod rig pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus is stated in order to demonstrate the proper amount of food.

original: sngon @234b gyi tshor ba dag spangs pas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: sngon @234b gyi tshor ba dag spangs pas ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of abandoning the former feeling?

original: bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde bar 'gyur bar so sor rtog go //
analyzed: bdag 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde bar 'gyur bar so sor rtog go //
translated: I will live, be strong, and be happy.

original: tshor ba gsar pa bskyed par mi bya bas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: tshor ba gsar pa bskyed par mi bya bas ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the use of producing new feelings?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i reg pa la gnas so zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i reg pa la gnas so zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: He discerns that he is abiding in contact that is free from reprehensible objects.

original: de la kha zas mang por za ba'i skyon med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la kha zas mang por za ba'i skyon med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as free from reprehensible contact because he is free from the fault of eating too much.

original: skyon de dag kyang lnga ste /
analyzed: skyon de dag kyang lnga ste /
translated: There are five faults:

original: g-yeng ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / glal ba dang / zas ma snyoms pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / glal ba dang / zas ma snyoms pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid do //
translated: distraction, unhappiness, yawning, imbalance of the humors, and mental depression.

original: sbyangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus yang bas ni bde bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus yang bas ni bde bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is light in body, in accord with purification, and thus lives happily.

original: reg pa la gnas bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa la gnas bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as abiding in contact.

original: bsam pa gang gis bza' bar mi bya ba dang / bsam pa gang gis bza' bar bya ba dang / tshod ci tsam zhig za ba'i phan yon de las so sor brtags nas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas khas zas za ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis bza' bar mi bya ba dang / bsam pa gang gis bza' bar bya ba dang / tshod ci tsam zhig za ba'i phan yon de las so sor brtags nas za ba'i phyir so sor brtags nas khas zas za ba yin no //
translated: One should eat food after reflecting on the benefits of eating the proper amount, with the proper attitude, and with the proper reflection.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bsdus pa'i don 'di ni gzhan te ;üîΩbde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang 'grogs pa dang / dgod pa dang / 'khrig pa dang / yongs su spyod pa las byung ba rnam pa bzhis khyim pa rnams kyi mdog gsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bsdus pa'i don 'di ni gzhan te ; bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang 'grogs pa dang / dgod pa dang / 'khrig pa dang / yongs su spyod pa las byung ba rnam pa bzhis khyim pa rnams kyi mdog gsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is different.üîΩThe complexion of householders is clear due to the four kinds of pleasure, happiness, joy, and delight that arise from sexual activity.

original: de dang bral bas log par rab tu byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'dod pa bor ba la dga' ba nyid dang / 'dod pa ma thob pa nyid dang / don du gnyer ba nyid dang / yo byad thob pa la lhag par chags te yongs su spyad pa nyid kyis mdog ngan par snang la /
analyzed: de dang bral bas log par rab tu byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'dod pa bor ba la dga' ba nyid dang / 'dod pa ma thob pa nyid dang / don du gnyer ba nyid dang / yo byad thob pa la lhag par chags te yongs su spyad pa nyid kyis mdog ngan par snang la /
translated: The complexion of those who have renounced the world in a distorted way is bad due to the absence of those four, due to the pleasure of abandoning desire, due to the absence of desire, due to the absence of delight in sexual activity, and due to the absence of delight in the objects that are obtained.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pas yang dag par rab tu byung ba rnams kyi mdog gsal bar mthong nas mdog gsal ba'i rgyu lhas zhus so //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pas yang dag par rab tu byung ba rnams kyi mdog gsal bar mthong nas mdog gsal ba'i rgyu lhas zhus so //
translated: Having seen that the complexion of those who have gone forth is clear due to the abandonment of those secondary afflictions, the gods asked about the cause of the clear complexion.

original: mdog gsal ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can de med kyang ji ltar yang dag par rab tu byung ba rnams kyi mdog gsal bar 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: mdog gsal ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can de med kyang ji ltar yang dag par rab tu byung ba rnams kyi mdog gsal bar 'gyur ba de /
translated: The Blessed One declared that although that afflicted cause of the clear complexion does not exist, the complexion of those who have gone forth becomes clear in the following way:

original: 'das pa la ni ma chags shing //
analyzed: 'das pa la ni ma chags shing //
translated: Not attached to the past,üîΩnot longing for the future,üîΩand not dwelling on the present,üîΩthe monk does not delight in sensual pleasures.

original: zhes rgya cher bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to //
translated: Thus the Blessed One declared in detail.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las drug pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las drug pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
translated: This concludes the summary of the meaning of the sixth chapter.

original: // / chos la kun dga' chos la dga' //
analyzed: // / chos la kun dga' chos la dga' //
translated: Rejoicing in the Dharma, delighting in the Dharma,

original: chos rnams rjes su rnam sems shing //
analyzed: chos rnams rjes su rnam sems shing //
translated: contemplating the Dharma,

original: chos rnams dran pa'i dge slong ni //
analyzed: chos rnams dran pa'i dge slong ni //
translated: a monk who is mindful of the Dharma

original: chos las yongs su nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chos las yongs su nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: does not fall away from the Dharma.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa 'di ci'i @235a * //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o // tshigs su bcad pa 'di ci'i @235a * //
translated: This is the verse.

original: phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why was this verse spoken?

original: lung dang rtogs pa'i chos las mi nyams pa'i rgyu las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa'i chos las mi nyams pa'i rgyu las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of not degenerating from the Dharma of transmission and realization.

original: de la chos la kun dga' ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos gzung ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa rnams kyis de la gzhol ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //üîΩchos la dga' ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de la chos la kun dga' ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos gzung ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa rnams kyis de la gzhol ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o // chos la dga' ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos te /
translated: Therein, delight in the Dharma should be understood as the Dharma of teaching, such as the Sutras, etc., through the doors of retention, recitation, and teaching.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i thabs skyed pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i thabs skyed pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Delight in the Dharma should be understood as the Dharma of practice, through the door of delight in the generation of the means of completely extinguishing the afflictions, such as right view, etc.

original: de nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mdo sde las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin /
analyzed: de nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mdo sde las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin /
translated: Then, the dharmas of affliction and purification, as they occur in the Sutras,

original: rnam sems shing goms par byed pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam sems shing goms par byed pa ni dran pa nye bar gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are contemplated and cultivated, and through the establishment of mindfulness, one does not degenerate from the resultant dharmas.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / phan yon ston par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / phan yon ston par byed de /
translated: In one sense, this verse shows the cause and benefit of accomplishing hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: 'dir chos la kun dga' ba ni gzung ba dang / kha ton dang bstan pa la brtson pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos la kun dga' ba ni gzung ba dang / kha ton dang bstan pa la brtson pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, delight in the Dharma should be understood in terms of striving to take up, recite, and teach the Dharma.

original: chos la dga' ba ni de la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba ni de la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Love of the Dharma is due to being devoted to it.

original: chos la kun dga' ba dang / chos la dga' bas ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: chos la kun dga' ba dang / chos la dga' bas ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed de /
translated: Delight in the Dharma and love of the Dharma accomplish the wisdom that arises from hearing.

original: ma thos pa thos par byed cing /
analyzed: ma thos pa thos par byed cing /
translated: One hears what has not been heard.

original: thos pa yang byung bar byed de /
analyzed: thos pa yang byung bar byed de /
translated: One hears what has been heard again and again.

original: dri ma med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri ma med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means one makes it stainless.

original: chos rnams rjes su rnam sems shing //
analyzed: chos rnams rjes su rnam sems shing //
translated: One reflects on the teachings.

original: zhes bya bas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed do //
translated: This accomplishes the wisdom that arises from reflection.üîΩOne recollects the teachings.

original: chos rnams rjes su dran par byed pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos rnams rjes su dran par byed pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub par byed do //
translated: This accomplishes the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: de dag ni shes rab gsum gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab gsum gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: These are the causes of the three wisdoms.

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong lung dang rtogs pa'i chos las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni phan yon yin no //üîΩ'dir dge slong ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'am /
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong lung dang rtogs pa'i chos las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni phan yon yin no // 'dir dge slong ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'am /
translated: The benefit is that a monk who possesses such virtues does not fall away from the Dharma of scripture and realization.

original: gzhom par zhugs pa la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhom par zhugs pa la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Here, a monk is one who has destroyed the defilements or is engaged in their destruction.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las bdun pa'i don bsdus pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las bdun pa'i don bsdus pa'o / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: This is the summary of the seventh chapter.

original: mkhas gang 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten du //
analyzed: mkhas gang 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten du //
translated: The wise who in the world of life

original: dad dang shes rab rnyed pa ni /
analyzed: dad dang shes rab rnyed pa ni /
translated: have gained faith and wisdom

original: de nyid 'di yi nor mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yi nor mchog ste /
translated: have the best of riches;

original: 'di yi nor gzhan dman pa yin //üîΩzhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yi nor gzhan dman pa yin // zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: other riches are inferior.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di @235b ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di @235b ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Lord teach this?

original: nor bu dang dngul dang gser la sogs pa phyi rol gyi nor ngan pa la lhag par chags pa rnams nang gi nor bzang po la yang dag par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu dang dngul dang gser la sogs pa phyi rol gyi nor ngan pa la lhag par chags pa rnams nang gi nor bzang po la yang dag par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to properly engage those who are attached to inferior external riches such as jewels, silver, and gold in the superior internal riches.

original: mkhas pa smos pa ni dad pa dang // shes rab dag thob pa'i gzhir bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mkhas pa smos pa ni dad pa dang // shes rab dag thob pa'i gzhir bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the wise is to show the basis for attaining faith and wisdom.

original: rang bzhin gyis mkhas ba dang ldan pas ni legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa rnams kyi don kun shes par nus shing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mkhas ba dang ldan pas ni legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa rnams kyi don kun shes par nus shing /
translated: One who is naturally wise is able to understand the meaning of good explanations and bad explanations.

original: dad pa dang shes rab kyang thob ste /üîΩnus pa med pa'am /
analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab kyang thob ste / nus pa med pa'am /
translated: He attains faith and wisdom.üîΩHe does not attain them through lack of ability

original: log par lta bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log par lta bas ni ma yin no //
translated: or through wrong views.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni rus btsal te /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni rus btsal te /
translated: The one who is called a person is one who is sought out by his clan.

original: rigs bzhi las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs bzhi las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: He is one of the four castes.

original: 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten du zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'phags pa 'byung ba'i gnas 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten du zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'phags pa 'byung ba'i gnas 'dir ro //
translated: In the world of the living means in this world of the living, which is the place where the noble ones appear.

original: mi'i 'jig rten du blta ste /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten du blta ste /
translated: One should look in the human world.

original: der de dag rnyed par srid par dgongs pa'i phyir dang / mi rnams nor la lhag par chags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der de dag rnyed par srid par dgongs pa'i phyir dang / mi rnams nor la lhag par chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it is thought possible to find them there, and because humans are especially attached to wealth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi dag ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi dang / lha dag las khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi dag ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi dang / lha dag las khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The humans of Jambudvipa are superior to the humans of Godaniya, Videha, and Kuru in three respects:

original: dpa' ba dang / dran pa dang ldan pa zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpa' ba dang / dran pa dang ldan pa zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they are courageous, they have a strong sense of shame, and they have strong mindfulness.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir tshangs par spyod pa gnas pa dang / skyo ba mang ba dang shes rab rno bas so zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir tshangs par spyod pa gnas pa dang / skyo ba mang ba dang shes rab rno bas so zhe'o //
translated: Others say: Here, the practice of pure conduct, the abundance of disgust, and the sharpness of wisdom are superior.üîΩFaith is the clarity and desire that exist, that possess qualities, and that are able.

original: dad pa ni yod pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / nus pa nyid la rim pa bzhin du mngon par zhen pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa ste sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang /üîΩyon tan dang ldan pa nyid la dang ba'i rnam pa dang / nus pa nyid la bdag gis thos pa'am /
analyzed: dad pa ni yod pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / nus pa nyid la rim pa bzhin du mngon par zhen pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa ste sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid la dang ba'i rnam pa dang / nus pa nyid la bdag gis thos pa'am /
translated: It is the aspect of conviction that exists, the aspect of clarity that possesses qualities, and the aspect of desire that is able.

original: bsgrub par nus so snyam pa 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par nus so snyam pa 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the desire that thinks, I can obtain it or accomplish it.

original: shes rab ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the thorough differentiation of things.

original: the tshom bzlog pa'i lam can no //
analyzed: the tshom bzlog pa'i lam can no //
translated: It is the path that turns away doubt.

original: dad pas ni dam pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i rgyur ston la /
analyzed: dad pas ni dam pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i rgyur ston la /
translated: Faith is taught as the cause for entering into the true Dharma.

original: shes rab kyis ni de mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi rgyur bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni de mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi rgyur bstan te /
translated: Wisdom is taught as the cause for not being carried away from it.

original: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis skra dang / kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig dag bgos nas yang dag pa nyid du dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩmdo sde'i dum bu 'dis ni dag @236a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis skra dang / kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig dag bgos nas yang dag pa nyid du dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis ni dag @236a * //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One said: ‚ÄúHaving shaved off hair and beard, and having put on the saffron robes, one goes forth from home to homelessness with true faith.‚Äù

analyzed: de la dge slong gi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni /

original: skra dang kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs te /

analyzed: gos dur smrig dag bgos nas zhes bya ba ni cha byad phun sum tshogs pa ste /

analyzed: cha byad 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir khyim pa'i cha byad las phun sum tshogs pa yin no //

analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni las phun sum tshogs pa ste /

analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / rang gis rtags blangs pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: dad pas zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /

original: bu lon gyis skrag pa'i phyir ma yin /

analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: dad pas so //

analyzed: dad pas dam pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan zin to //

analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab can ni bdag nyid kyis bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos rjes su dran nas sbyor bar byed pa yin te /

analyzed: shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba rnam par grol bar byed de /

analyzed: ma dad pa ni zhe sdang gi khyad par ro zhes 'byung ba 'di'i gnyen po'i don du rig par bya ste /

original: nor bas dad pa nor mchog ste //

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las dgu pa'i don bsdus pa'o /

analyzed: bsam pa ni de dag nyid dbye zhing mi 'dum par sems pa'o //
translated: The intention is the wish to divide them and keep them from reconciling.

original: sbyor ba ni de don du rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de don du rtsom pa'o //
translated: The performance is the effort for that purpose.

original: nyon mongs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The affliction is attachment and so on.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang las byung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang las byung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: That which arises from attachment and aversion is as before.

original: gti mug las byung ba ni phra ma byas pas nyes pa ci yang med do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ni phra ma byas pas nyes pa ci yang med do snyam pa'o //
translated: That which arises from delusion is the thought that there is no fault in divisive speech.

original: mthar phyin pa ni dbye bas go ba'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni dbye bas go ba'o //
translated: The completion is the understanding of the division.

original: tshig rtsub po'i gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po'i gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The basis of harsh speech is sentient beings who are a cause of complete irritation.

original: bsam pa ni las kyi lam ste 'byed 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni las kyi lam ste 'byed 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention is the desire to divide.

original: sbyor ba ni de'i don du rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de'i don du rtsom pa'o //
translated: The performance is the effort for that purpose.

original: nyon mongs pa ni phra ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni phra ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The affliction is as in slander.

original: mthar phyin pa ni tshig rtsub po smras pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni tshig rtsub po smras pa'o //
translated: The completion is the speaking of harsh words.

original: tshig 'khyal pa'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The basis of senseless speech is a meaningless object.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The intention and performance are as before.

original: nyon mongs pa ni chags @239b pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni chags @239b pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The affliction is attachment and so on.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang las byung ba'i tshig 'khyal pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang las byung ba'i tshig 'khyal pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Senseless speech arising from attachment and aversion is as before.

original: gti mug las byung ba ni glu len pa dang / bstan bcos bzang po ma yin pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba ni glu len pa dang / bstan bcos bzang po ma yin pa smra ba'o //
translated: That arising from delusion is singing songs and speaking bad treatises.

original: mthar phyin pa ni smras pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni smras pa'o //
translated: The completion is the speaking.

original: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor zas dang yo byad do //üîΩbsam pa ni de la der 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor zas dang yo byad do // bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes pa'am /
translated: The basis of covetousness is the wealth, food, and possessions of another.

original: de bzhin 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception of that as that or the desire for it to be so.

original: sbyor ba ni de bdag gir bya bar yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de bdag gir bya bar yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The performance is the complete grasping of it as one's own.

original: nyon mongs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The affliction is as before.

original: mthar phyin pa ni bdag gir bya bar nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni bdag gir bya bar nges par byas pa'o //
translated: The culmination is the definite decision to appropriate.

original: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa sems can rnams so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa sems can rnams so //
translated: The basis of malice is sentient beings who are the cause of complete irritation.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The intention and application are as before.

original: mthar phyin ba ni rdeg pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin ba ni rdeg pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
translated: The culmination is the definite decision to beat, etc.

original: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / byed pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / byed pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The basis of wrong views is the existent object, cause and effect, action, etc.

original: gang la dmigs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i log par lta bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la dmigs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i log par lta bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: , in regard to which one engages in the wrong view that denies cause and effect and action, and the wrong view that annihilates existent things.

original: de la sbyin pa med do //üîΩmchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: There is no giving.üîΩThere is no offering.

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: There is no sacrifice.

original: legs par byas pa med do //
analyzed: legs par byas pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.üîΩThere is no misconduct.

original: nyes par byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: This is the denial of cause.

original: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu med do zhes zer ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu med do zhes zer ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Those who say, There is no result of good or bad actions, deny the result.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: Those who say, There is no this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: There is no other world, deny the activity of coming and going to another world.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: Those who say, There is no mother,

original: pha med do zhes zer ba ni sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o ;
analyzed: pha med do zhes zer ba ni sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o ;
translated: There is no father, deny the activity of planting the seed.

original: ; rdzus te skye ba'i sems can med do zhes zer ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sbrel pa'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: ; rdzus te skye ba'i sems can med do zhes zer ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sbrel pa'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Those who say, There are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally, deny the activity of linking in the womb.

original: 'jig rten 'di na dgra bcom pa med do zhes zer ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na dgra bcom pa med do zhes zer ba ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Those who say, There are no arhats in this world, destroy what exists.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa mngon du btang ba'i log par lta ba yang brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa mngon du btang ba'i log par lta ba yang brjod do //
translated: Moreover, wrong views are also mentioned as the manifestation of listening to what is not the true Dharma and so on.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The intention, the application, and the defilement are as above.

original: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: There is, however, a difference.üîΩCovetousness, malice and false view are called arisen from attachment, etc.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba la de las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba la de las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because they occur immediately after attachment, etc.

original: mthar phyin pa ni skur pa 'debs par @240a * //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni skur pa 'debs par @240a * //
translated: The completion of the action is the determination to slander.

original: nges pa'o ; / de ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag dang bral ba ni log par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'o ; / de ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag dang bral ba ni log par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the ten unwholesome courses of action are completed by the three mental actions.

original: yang las kyi lam zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang las kyi lam zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term karmapatha, course of action?

original: brnab sems la sogs pa gsum ni las kyi lam yin pas las kyi lam ste /üîΩde dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni de dag gi grogs su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa gsum ni las kyi lam yin pas las kyi lam ste / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni de dag gi grogs su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Three, covetousness, malice and false view, are the course of action because they are action.

original: de'i dbang gis mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental factors associated with them are their companions because they are formed by the power of those mental factors.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gi las yin pa'i phyir las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gi las yin pa'i phyir las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin te /
translated: The seven, killing, etc., are action and the course of action because they are bodily and vocal action.

original: las kyi lam ni de dag kun du slong ba'i sems pad dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi lam ni de dag kun du slong ba'i sems pad dag la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The paths of action are established in dependence on the volition that instigates them.

original: de ltar las kyi lam dang las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin pas las kyi lam rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi lam dang las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin pas las kyi lam rnams so //
translated: Thus, they are paths of action because they are actions and also paths of action.

original: thos pas don ma yin pa spong //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'dul ba bstan pa las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa thos nas de la brten te gang la byis pa rnams kyi don du 'du shes pa don ma yin par gyur pa 'dod pa
analyzed: thos pas don ma yin pa spong // zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'dul ba bstan pa las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa thos nas de la brten te gang la byis pa rnams kyi don du 'du shes pa don ma yin par gyur pa 'dod pa
translated: One abandons the meaningless through learning.

original: rnams spong bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnams spong bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: One abandons the meaningless through learning, just as one abandons the meaningless pursuits of childish beings who are attached to objects by learning the training of mind taught by the TathƒÅgata in the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: thos pas mya ngan 'das pa thob //
analyzed: thos pas mya ngan 'das pa thob //
translated: One obtains nirvana through learning.

original: ces bya ba ni ji ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'dul ba bstan pa las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa thos nas de la brten te nyon mongs pa zad ba mya ngan las 'das pa thos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'dul ba bstan pa las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa thos nas de la brten te nyon mongs pa zad ba mya ngan las 'das pa thos pa lta bu'o //
translated: One obtains nirvana through learning, just as one obtains the exhaustion of affliction and nirvana through learning the training in wisdom taught by the TathƒÅgata in the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang bslab pa gsum la brten te sdig pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / 'dod pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / srid pa las yang dag par 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang bslab pa gsum la brten te sdig pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / 'dod pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / srid pa las yang dag par 'das pa bstan to //
translated: The condensed meaning is that this verse shows the attainment of right view, the transcendence of evil, the transcendence of desire, and the transcendence of existence, based on the three trainings.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par 'das pa bstan to //
translated: Or else, it shows the transcendence of the defilements of entry into the teaching, action, affliction, and life.

original: de lta bas na bdag nyid legs su 'dod pa'i phan yon de lta bu 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi bka' mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag nyid legs su 'dod pa'i phan yon de lta bu 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi bka' mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who desires such benefits for oneself should listen to the Buddha's teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'di ni me dang chu dang 'jug ngogs la sogs pa lta bur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'di ni me dang chu dang 'jug ngogs la sogs pa lta bur blta bar bya ste /
translated: This Buddha's teaching should be seen as like fire, water, a ford, etc.

original: ji ltar na me lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na me lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it like fire?

original: 'di ltar mes ni bya ba bzhi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes ni bya ba bzhi byed de /
translated: Thus, fire performs four functions:

original: sreg pa dang / smin pa dang / gdung bar byed pa @240b dang ; snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sreg pa dang / smin pa dang / gdung bar byed pa @240b dang ; snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: It burns, it cooks, it heats, it shines.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi mes bya ba bzhi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi mes bya ba bzhi byed de /
translated: Likewise, the fire of the Buddha's word performs four actions:

original: rgyud smin pa las nyon mongs pa sreg pa dang / rgyud ma smin pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams smin pa dang / gdul bya bag med pa rnams dang bdud kyi 'dod pa bar du gcod pa skyed pa'i phyir gdung bar byed pa dang ;üîΩthe tshom can dang lam ngan par gnas pa rnams la snang bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyud smin pa las nyon mongs pa sreg pa dang / rgyud ma smin pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams smin pa dang / gdul bya bag med pa rnams dang bdud kyi 'dod pa bar du gcod pa skyed pa'i phyir gdung bar byed pa dang ; the tshom can dang lam ngan par gnas pa rnams la snang bar byed pa yin te /
translated: It burns the defilements in the stream which is ripe for purification; it cooks the roots of good in the stream which is not ripe; it heats the disci ples who are negligent; it shines for those who doubt and for those who are on bad paths.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It shines for those who doubt, because it removes doubt; it shines for those who are on bad paths, because it teaches the right path and the wrong path.

original: ji ltar na chu lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chu lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it like water?

original: chu ni phan pa rnam ba lnga byed de /
analyzed: chu ni phan pa rnam ba lnga byed de /
translated: Water is useful in five ways:

original: spang bar bya ba 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa spangs par byed pa dang / lus dang gos dang snod dag gi dri ma 'khru bar byed pa dang / lus kyi yongs su gdung bzhi bar byed pa dang / skom pa la sred pa rnam par zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa spangs par byed pa dang / lus dang gos dang snod dag gi dri ma 'khru bar byed pa dang / lus kyi yongs su gdung bzhi bar byed pa dang / skom pa la sred pa rnam par zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: It removes the chaff of those things to be abandoned, it cleans the stains of body, clothing and vessels, it cools the burning of the body, it allays the craving of thirst,

original: rtsva dang lo thog dang nags tshal skyed par byed cing 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang lo thog dang nags tshal skyed par byed cing 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: and it produces and increases the grass, herbs, trees, and forests.üîΩIn the same way, the water of the Buddha's speech produces and increases the grass, herbs, trees, and forests of the qualities of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi chu yang dad pa skyed pas gdul bar bya ba'i rgyud spangs pa dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma 'khru bar byed pa dang / 'dod pas yongs su gdung bzhi bar byed pa dang / yang srid pa'i sred pa gdul bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi chu yang dad pa skyed pas gdul bar bya ba'i rgyud spangs pa dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma 'khru bar byed pa dang / 'dod pas yongs su gdung bzhi bar byed pa dang / yang srid pa'i sred pa gdul bar byed pa dang /
translated: It produces faith in those to be trained, it cleans the stain of immorality, it cools the burning of craving, it allays the craving for renewed existence,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i yon tan gyi rtsva dang lo thog dang nags tshal skyed par byed cing 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i yon tan gyi rtsva dang lo thog dang nags tshal skyed par byed cing 'phel bar byed do //
translated: and it produces and increases the grass, herbs, trees, and forests of the qualities of the factors of enlightenment.

original: ci ltar na 'jug ngogs bde ba lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'jug ngogs bde ba lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it like a pleasant shore?

original: rgyu lnga dag gis 'jug ngogs bde ba la rten par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag gis 'jug ngogs bde ba la rten par byed de /
translated: It is a pleasant shore for five reasons:

original: dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang / gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sred pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i rtse ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang ; tshu rol nas pha rol du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang / gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sred pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i rtse ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang ; tshu rol nas pha rol du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to wash away the stains of immorality, in order to pacify the torment of craving, in order to subdue craving, in order to experience the joy of play, and in order to go from this shore to the other shore.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten pa ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang srid pa'i srid pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten pa ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang srid pa'i srid pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha‚Äôs speech is a pleasant shore, because it washes away the stains of immorality, because it pacifies the torment of craving, because it subdues the craving for existence,

original: bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can la dga' ba'i rtse ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol 'jig tshogs las pha rol mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can la dga' ba'i rtse ba myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol 'jig tshogs las pha rol mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the enjoyment of the play of those qualities, and because it is the passage from this shore of the perishable perishable aggregates to the other shore of nirvana.

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum po dag gis @241a * //üîΩras yug la gzugs mngon par 'grub par mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum po dag gis @241a * // ras yug la gzugs mngon par 'grub par mi nus te /
translated: The three causes areüîΩthe cloth, the dye, and the dyer.

original: ras yug mi brtan pa dang / dri ma can dang ma snyoms pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir dang / tshon rtsi mi bzang ba'i phyir dang / ri mo mkhan ma bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ras yug mi brtan pa dang / dri ma can dang ma snyoms pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir dang / tshon rtsi mi bzang ba'i phyir dang / ri mo mkhan ma bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cloth is not firm, is stained, and is uneven, the dye is poor, and the dyer is unskilled.

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi ras yug la rgyu gsum dag gis yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi ras yug la rgyu gsum dag gis yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, in the cloth of the listener‚Äôs mind, the form of right knowledge is not produced because of three causes.

original: de mi brtan pa dang / dri ma can dang / ma snyoms pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: sna la mngon par dga' ba rnams kyi chags pa spang ba'i thabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dir ni gnas gsum 'di dag gis //üîΩlha rnams kyi ni nang du 'gro //
