analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba ni lus dang / ngag gi las kho na rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: That which arises from morality is only the three types of bodily and vocal actions.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba la byams pa dang / snying rje ni bsod nams dang bya ba'i dngos po yang yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba la byams pa dang / snying rje ni bsod nams dang bya ba'i dngos po yang yin te /
translated: That which arises from meditation is love and compassion, which are both merit and the basis of merit-making.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa byams pa dang snying rje'i sgo nas mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa byams pa dang snying rje'i sgo nas mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intention concomitant with them is the formative force through the doors of love and compassion.

original: yang na bsod nams kyi byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams kyi byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, the basis of merit-making is the action of merit;

original: bsod nams kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: it is the application of merit.

original: de'i dngos po ni de dag ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de dag ste /
translated: These are its bases.

original: de dag bsgrub pa'i don du bsod nams kyi sbyor ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgrub pa'i don du bsod nams kyi sbyor ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one undertakes the practice of merit in order to accomplish those.

original: yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rnam par smin pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rnam par smin pa'i khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinctive maturation of the meritorious action that consists of giving?

original: sbyin pa po dang / dngos po dang / zhing gi khyad par gyis 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang / dngos po dang / zhing gi khyad par gyis 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: The distinctive result is due to the distinctive giver, object, and field.

original: de la sbyin pa po'i khyad par ni dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gus pa dang / rang gi lag dang / dus su dang / gnod pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa po'i khyad par ni dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gus pa dang / rang gi lag dang / dus su dang / gnod pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The distinctive giver is one who possesses the qualities of faith, morality, learning, and so on, and who gives respectfully, with one's own hand, at the appropriate time, and without harming others.

original: dad pas sbyin pa byin pas ni yo byad thams cad phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: dad pas sbyin pa byin pas ni yo byad thams cad phun sum tshogs so //
translated: One who gives with faith obtains all the requisites.

original: gus par byin pas ni bkur sti thob pa phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: gus par byin pas ni bkur sti thob pa phun sum tshogs so //
translated: One who gives respectfully obtains abundant honor.

original: rang gi lag nas byin pas ni yongs su spyod pa rgya chen po la mos pa phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: rang gi lag nas byin pas ni yongs su spyod pa rgya chen po la mos pa phun sum tshogs so //
translated: Giving with one's own hand is the perfection of extensive enjoyment.

original: dus su byin pas ni dus su thob pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: dus su byin pas ni dus su thob pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs so //
translated: Giving at the right time is the perfection of timely enjoyment.

original: gnod pa med par byin pas ni bar chad med pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med par byin pas ni bar chad med pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Giving without doing harm is the perfection of uninterrupted enjoyment.

original: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo dang mthun no //
analyzed: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo dang mthun no //
translated: Monks, these five are the gifts of a holy person.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig sbyin pa pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig sbyin pa pa'i khyad par te /
translated: This is the difference in the giver.

original: de'i khyad par las rnam par smin pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //üîΩdngos po'i khyad par ni kha dog la sogs @250a * //
analyzed: de'i khyad par las rnam par smin pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro // dngos po'i khyad par ni kha dog la sogs @250a * //
translated: The difference in the result of evolution is due to the difference in the giver.

original: ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The difference in the thing given is the perfection of color, etc.

original: gal te sbyin par bya ba gang yin pa de kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yang rung ba phun sum tshogs pa yin na dngos po de khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sbyin par bya ba gang yin pa de kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yang rung ba phun sum tshogs pa yin na dngos po de khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thing given is perfect in color, smell, taste, and potency, that thing is excellent.

original: dngos po khyad par can de lta bu byin pa'i rnam par smin pa ci 'dra ba zhig tse na /
analyzed: dngos po khyad par can de lta bu byin pa'i rnam par smin pa ci 'dra ba zhig tse na /
translated: What is the maturation of giving such special things?

original: rim bzhin du gzugs bzang ba nyid dang / grags pa nyid dang / dga' ba nyid dang / shin tu gzhon zhing dus tshigs su reg na bde ba'i lus so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rim bzhin du gzugs bzang ba nyid dang / grags pa nyid dang / dga' ba nyid dang / shin tu gzhon zhing dus tshigs su reg na bde ba'i lus so zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that one becomes respectively: beautiful, famous, loved, and having a body that is very youthful and pleasant to touch.

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni gzugs bzang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni gzugs bzang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving perfect color, one becomes beautiful.

original: dri phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni grags pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni grags pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: By giving perfect smell, one becomes famous,

original: dri bzhin du grags pas phyogs su khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri bzhin du grags pas phyogs su khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one's fame spreads everywhere like a good smell.

original: ro phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni ro zhim pa dang 'dra bar dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni ro zhim pa dang 'dra bar dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving perfect taste, one becomes as sweet as a delicious taste.

original: reg pa phun sum tshogs pa byin pas 'di'i lus shin tu gzhon sha can dang / dus tshigs su reg na bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa phun sum tshogs pa byin pas 'di'i lus shin tu gzhon sha can dang / dus tshigs su reg na bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: By giving perfect touch, one has a very youthful body and a body that is pleasant to touch in all seasons.

original: bud med rin po che'i bzhin no //
analyzed: bud med rin po che'i bzhin no //
translated: This is like the precious woman.

original: zhing ni 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / phan pa byed pa nyid kyi yon tan dag gis khyad par du 'gyur te /üîΩ'gro ba'i khyad par las re zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ji skad du /
analyzed: zhing ni 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / phan pa byed pa nyid kyi yon tan dag gis khyad par du 'gyur te / 'gro ba'i khyad par las re zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ji skad du /
translated: The field is distinguished by the qualities of being a living being, being miserable, and being a benefactor.üîΩThe field is distinguished by the quality of being a living being, as the Blessed One said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you give to one born as an animal, you can expect a hundredfold karmic maturation.

original: tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i mi la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i mi la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: If you give to a human who is observing morality, you can expect a thousandfold karmic maturation.‚ÄùüîΩThe field is distinguished by the quality of being miserable, as in the case of the meritorious activities that are the basis of material t·πõi·πÉ≈õikƒÅ, 19b

original: nad g-yog la sbyin pa dang / gang ba la sogs pa la sbyin pa gsungs nas rdzas las byung pa'i bsod nams dngos po 'di bdun po dag ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: nad g-yog la sbyin pa dang / gang ba la sogs pa la sbyin pa gsungs nas rdzas las byung pa'i bsod nams dngos po 'di bdun po dag ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: The Sutra says that the son or daughter of good lineage who possesses these seven things,

original: rigs kyi bu mo ni 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo ni 'gro ba'am /
translated: whether walking,

original: 'dug gam gnyid log gam /
analyzed: 'dug gam gnyid log gam /
translated: standing, sleeping, or awake,

original: sad pa na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba nyid dang / bsod nams nye bar skye ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sad pa na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba nyid dang / bsod nams nye bar skye ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: always and uninterruptedly increases in merit and generates merit.

original: 'dir ni rkyen gyi bye brag @250b las sdug bsngal gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rkyen gyi bye brag @250b las sdug bsngal gyi khyad par te /
translated: Here, the difference in suffering is due to the difference in conditions.

original: len pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par med par byas pa las sbyin pa po'i 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par med par byas pa las sbyin pa po'i 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference in the result for the giver is due to the difference in the suffering of the receiver, without regard to the difference in the suffering of the giver.

original: phan bar byed pa nyid kyi khyad par ni ji ltar /
analyzed: phan bar byed pa nyid kyi khyad par ni ji ltar /
translated: The difference in the benefit is like this:

original: ma dang / pha dang / gzhan yang phan pa byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: ma dang / pha dang / gzhan yang phan pa byed pa dag ste /
translated: Mother, father, and others who are helpful.

original: dom gyi skyes pa'i rabs lta bur phan pa byed pa la gnod pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir phan pa'i lan lon pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: dom gyi skyes pa'i rabs lta bur phan pa byed pa la gnod pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir phan pa'i lan lon pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The bear jƒÅtaka shows that the result of benefit is the repayment of benefit, since the result of the benefit he did was seen to be harm.üîΩThe result of the distinctive qualities is stated in the sutra:

original: yon tan gyi khyad par las ni ji ltar tshul khrims can la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par las ni ji ltar tshul khrims can la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one gives to those who possess morality, the karmic maturation is a hundred thousand times greater.

original: bsod nams dag gi rnam smin bde //
analyzed: bsod nams dag gi rnam smin bde //
translated: The karmic maturation of merit is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par bshad zin to //
translated: The distinctive qualities of the basis of the meritorious action of giving have been explained.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro dang / byang grol thob pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro dang / byang grol thob pa ste /
translated: The result of the basis of the meritorious action of morality is the attainment of happy rebirth and liberation.

original: sgrub pa dang thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of establishing and attaining those.

original: ci ltar na byang grol tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni smon pa 'grub ste /üîΩde rnam par dag pa'i phyir de tshul khrims kyi zhes ston to //
analyzed: ci ltar na byang grol tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni smon pa 'grub ste /üîΩde rnam par dag pa'i phyir de tshul khrims kyi zhes ston to //
translated: How does morality cause the attainment of liberation?üîΩLiberation is attained because the mind is not remorseful.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni thar pa sgrub pa'i tshogs yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni thar pa sgrub pa'i tshogs yin te /
translated: Pure morality is the accumulation that establishes liberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid dang / kha zas la tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stong nyid dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa nyid dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid dang / kha zas la tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stong nyid dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa nyid dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: guarding the sense doors, knowing the limit in food, being watchful in the first and last periods of the night and striving in yoga, and being mindful.

original: rnam par dag pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its purity?

original: gnod pa bzhin po dag gis gnod pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnod pa bzhin po dag gis gnod pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not harmed by the four harms.

original: gnod pa bzhi ni gang dag gis gnod na /
analyzed: gnod pa bzhi ni gang dag gis gnod na /
translated: What are the four harms by which it is harmed?

original: tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa las gnod na yongs su ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa las gnod na yongs su ma dag pa ste /
translated: If morality is harmed by incomplete purity, it is incomplete.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnod pa dang / rten las su rung ba la gnod pa dang / mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnod pa dang / rten las su rung ba la gnod pa dang / mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The four harms are the harm of conceptuality, the harm of the unserviceability of the basis, the harm of nonexertion and the harm of regret.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid do //
translated: The antidote to the harm of discursive thought is the guarding of the sense-doors.

original: rten las su rung ba la gnod pa'i gnyen por ni kha zas la tshod rig pa nyid de /
analyzed: rten las su rung ba la gnod pa'i gnyen por ni kha zas la tshod rig pa nyid de /
translated: The antidote to the harm of unserviceability of the basis is the moderation of food.

original: tshod smos pa ni kha zas nyung ba dang mang ba spang ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshod smos pa ni kha zas nyung ba dang mang ba spang ba'i don to //
translated: The moderation of food is for the purpose of avoiding both little and much food.

original: kha zas nyung na ni rten nyam chung bas mngon par mi spro la kha zas mang na ni snyom pa la sogs pa'i skyon lnga kun du spyod pas rten las su mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: kha zas nyung na ni rten nyam chung bas mngon par mi spro la kha zas mang na ni snyom pa la sogs pa'i skyon lnga kun du spyod pas rten las su mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: If there is little food, the basis is weak and not vigorous. If there is much food, the five faults such as laziness are indulged in and the basis becomes unserviceable.

original: de ltar na de gnyis @251a * //üîΩkyis ni rten las su mi rung ba nyid la de med na ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de gnyis @251a * // kyis ni rten las su mi rung ba nyid la de med na ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these twoüîΩare antidotes to the harm of unserviceability of the basis.

original: mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar brtson pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar brtson pa nyid do //
translated: The antidote to the harm of non-exertion is the exertion in the first and last watches of the night.

original: 'gyod pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni shes bzhin du gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen por ni shes bzhin du gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The antidote to the harm of regret is to abide in full awareness.

original: de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the distinctive feature of morality.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The meditation that is distinctive is, in brief,

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The mundane path is the meditative development of the absorptions and the formless attainments.

original: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be known in terms of: (a) the afflicted, (b) purification and (c) the establishment of the latter.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩlung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na / lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: How so in regard to the afflicted?üîΩThe four indeterminate roots are craving, view, pride and ignorance. Craving is the affliction of relishing because it relishes the taste of the bliss of tranquillity.üîΩView is the affliction of false view because it is the cause of the latter.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pride is the affliction of conceit because it is the cause of the latter.üîΩIgnorance is the affliction of non-conscientiousness because it is the cause of the latter.

original: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: By view, the meditative development of the meditative absorption of one who is predominantly of views is defiled.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of the meditative absorptions,

original: sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the view that investigates the prior limit and so on is generated.

original: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: By pride, the meditative development of the meditative absorption of one who is predominantly of pride is defiled.

original: khyad par rtogs pa des khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa des khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is inflated by that special realization.

original: ma rig pas ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pas ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: By nescience, the meditative development of the meditative absorption of one who is predominantly of doubt is defiled.

original: de kho na nyid ma rtogs nas thar pa 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa de la thar pa'am thar pa ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma rtogs nas thar pa 'dod pa'i khyad par rtogs pa de la thar pa'am thar pa ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, not understanding reality, doubt arises in that special realization which is desirous of liberation, as to whether or not it is liberation.

original: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by purification?

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dag pa pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa yin yang dge ba'i phyir kun nas 'grib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dag pa pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa yin yang dge ba'i phyir kun nas 'grib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pure meditative attainment of the formless realm and the pure meditative attainment of the fourth meditation are called pure because they are free from the stain of diminution.

original: rnam par gzhag pas ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they established?

original: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first meditation has five members:

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: initial inquiry, investigation, joy, pleasure, and concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The second meditation has four members:

original: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' @251b ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' @251b ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: inner serenity, joy, pleasure, and concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third meditation has five members:

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, pleasure, and concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth meditation has four members:

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //üîΩgzugs med pa dag la ni yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do // gzugs med pa dag la ni yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
translated: and one-pointedness of mind.

original: zhi gnas su ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas su ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the formless states, there are no divisions of factors because they are of one taste in calm abiding.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi yan lag dbye ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi yan lag dbye ba ni /
translated: The divisions of factors in the absorptions are

original: gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / gnyi ga'i rten gyi bye brag gis te /üîΩbsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / gnyi ga'i rten gyi bye brag gis te / bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: due to the distinctions of antidotes, benefits, and the basis of both.

original: de dag gis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first absorption, investigation and analysis are the factors of antidote because they abandon the investigation and analysis of the desire realm and malice and violence.

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy and pleasure are the factors of benefit.

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas des dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas des dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one obtains the joy and pleasure born of that seclusion, having abandoned the opposing factors through investigation and analysis.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag ste /
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the limb that is the basis of both of those,

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis dge ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of concentration causes the engagement of virtuous thoughts, etc.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang yongs su dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang yongs su dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the second meditative absorption, inner clarity is the limb that is the antidote,

original: des rtog pa dang / dpyod pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rtog pa dang / dpyod pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abandons investigation and analysis.

original: bde ba dang dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: bde ba dang dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Joy and pleasure are the limbs that are benefits.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the limb that is the basis of both of those.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the third meditative absorption, equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are the limb that is the antidote,

original: de dag gis dga' ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis dga' ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abandon joy.

original: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Pleasure is the limb that is the benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the limb that is the basis for both.

original: rjes su dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of the meditative object.

original: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: Alertness is the awareness of laxity and excitement.

original: btang snyoms ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnal du 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnal du 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the state of balance that occurs when the secondary afflictions have been abandoned.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la gtang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni @252a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la gtang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni @252a * //
translated: In the fourth meditation, equanimity is the limb that is the antidote,üîΩbecause it abandons the equanimity of the third meditation, which is a form of satisfaction.

original: gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: Purity is the limb that is the benefit,

original: de dag gis bde ba spong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de dag gis bde ba spong ba'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: because it is the basis for the purity of the other limbs.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyis ka'i rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the limb that is the basis for both.

original: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it distinguished by purity?

original: rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: It is the culmination of excellence,

original: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: because it is the purity of the first meditation up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo //üîΩmthong ba'i lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo // mthong ba'i lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: The supramundane path is the path of insight and the path of cultivation.üîΩThe path of insight is the receptivity to the cognition of the teaching with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the teaching with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the receptivity to the cognition of the teaching with regard to the origin,

original: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang /
translated: the cognition of the teaching with regard to the origin, the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin, the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin, the receptivity to the cognition of the teaching with regard to cessation, the cognition of the teaching with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: 1. Acceptance of the cognition of the subsequent understanding of cessation, 2. cognition of the subsequent understanding of cessation, 3. acceptance of the cognition of the doctrine with regard to the path, 4. cognition of the doctrine with regard to the path, 5. acceptance of the cognition of the subsequent understanding of the path,

original: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: 6. cognition of the subsequent understanding of the path.

original: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa nas bzung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa nas bzung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path from the acceptance of the cognition of the subsequent understanding of the path up to the cognition of the subsequent understanding of the path.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi 'og tu zag pa med pa'i shes rab chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi 'og tu zag pa med pa'i shes rab chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye'o //
translated: Immediately after the supreme mundane factors, there arises the pure cognition, the acceptance of the cognition of the doctrine.

original: dmigs pa gang la zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what object?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa la ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa la ste /
translated: With regard to the realm of desire.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The acceptance of the cognition of the doctrine is the acceptance having the cognition of the doctrine for its cause.

original: 'bras bu dang me tog gi shing bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog gi shing bzhin no //
translated: Like a tree with fruit and flowers.

original: des ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang /
analyzed: des ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang /
translated: It abandons the ten afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering: desire, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view,

original: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu @252b 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba spong ngo //
analyzed: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu @252b 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba spong ngo //
translated: the view grasping rules and rituals as paramount, wrong view, and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme.

original: de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
translated: This is the path of liberation

original: bar chad med pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abandons the afflictions that are the uninterrupted phase.

original: de nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid la chos shes pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid la chos shes pa skye ba ste /
translated: Then, after the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, Dharma knowledge of that very suffering of the desire realm arises.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
translated: This is the path of liberationüîΩbecause it abandons the afflictions that are the path of liberation.

original: zag pa med par gtogs pa thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med par gtogs pa thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all of these are included in the uncontaminated state.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i 'og tu gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag la dmigs pa sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i 'og tu gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag la dmigs pa sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: After Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, there is perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, which focuses on all suffering of the form and formless realms.

original: des ni khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dgu spong ngo //
analyzed: des ni khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu dgu spong ngo //
translated: That perseverance abandons the nine afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, except for anger.

original: de nas rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa skye'o //
analyzed: de nas rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa skye'o //
translated: Then subsequent knowledge arises.

original: dang por chos kyi de kho na shes pa'i phyir chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: dang por chos kyi de kho na shes pa'i phyir chos shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is the first to know the reality of phenomena, it is Dharma knowledge.

original: de'i rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i phyir gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i phyir gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa ni rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Because it is subsequent knowledge of that, it is subsequent knowledge that focuses on the higher realms of form and formlessness.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is subsequent knowledge because it is subsequent to Dharma knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang / shes pa bzhi po dag kyang skye ba ji lta bar kun la byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang / shes pa bzhi po dag kyang skye ba ji lta bar kun la byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four aspects of perseverance and knowledge of the truth of suffering arise in the same way, and the four aspects of perseverance and knowledge of the truths of cessation and path also arise in the same way.

original: sdug bsngal rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba ste /
translated: After the knowledge that realizes the truth of suffering, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin that is the origin of the desire realm arises.

original: des ni 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang btul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun spong ngo //
analyzed: des ni 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang btul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun spong ngo //
translated: This eliminates seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: de nas kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Then there is Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i rim gyis kun 'byung ba lhag ma la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i rim gyis kun 'byung ba lhag ma la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
translated: In the same way, perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the remaining truths of origin arises in order of arising.

original: des ni khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa drug drug po de dag nyid spong ngo //
analyzed: des ni khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa drug drug po de dag nyid spong ngo //
translated: It abandons the six afflictions of the form and formless realms, except for anger.

original: de nas kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Next is subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /üîΩdes ni 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @253a * //
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste / des ni 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @253a * //
translated: Next is the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing that is related to the desire realm.

original: mongs pa bdun spong ste /
analyzed: mongs pa bdun spong ste /
translated: It abandons the seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: gang kun 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang kun 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the truth of origin.

original: de nas de nyid la 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de nyid la 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Next is Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
analyzed: de nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
translated: Next is the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing that is related to the form and formless realms.

original: des ni khong khro ba ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug ste de dag nyid spong ngo //
analyzed: des ni khong khro ba ba ma gtogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa drug drug ste de dag nyid spong ngo //
translated: It abandons the six afflictions of the form and formless realms, except for anger, that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: de nas 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Then there is subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
translated: Then, as an antidote to the suffering of the desire realm, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path arises.

original: des ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: des ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
translated: It abandons afflictions except for the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: de nas lam la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lam la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Then there is Dharma knowledge of the truth of path.

original: de nas lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
analyzed: de nas lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa skye ste /
translated: Then there is perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: de ni khong khro ba ma gtogs par gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun bdun spang ngo //
analyzed: de ni khong khro ba ma gtogs par gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun bdun spang ngo //
translated: It abandons seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path in the form and formless realms, except for anger.

original: de nas lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Then there is subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang bcas pa sems bcu drug po 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang bcas pa sems bcu drug po 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: These sixteen moments of mind, together with subsequent knowledge of the truth of path, are direct realization of the four truths.

original: bar chad med pa dang gzugs rnam par grol pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang gzugs rnam par grol pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are subsumed by the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing is so called because one sees what was not previously seen.

original: de la skad cig bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de la skad cig bco lnga'o //

original: bden pa ma mthong ba rnams mthong ba'i phyir gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba rnams mthong ba'i phyir gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The path of seeing is so called because one sees what was not previously seen, i.e., the truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag las gang zag de dang de'i dbang du mdzad nas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du chos mthong ba /üîΩchos thob pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag las gang zag de dang de'i dbang du mdzad nas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du chos mthong ba / chos thob pa /
translated: The Fortunate One, in the different Sutras, with reference to different persons, says: ‚ÄúIn such and such a person, the eye of the Dharma, pure and immaculate, arises; he sees the different natures of the factors, the different natures of the factors being the truths.üîΩHe sees the Dharma,

original: chos rtogs pa /üîΩchos kun nas brtan pa som nyi las rgal ba /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa / chos kun nas brtan pa som nyi las rgal ba /
translated: he obtains the Dharma,üîΩhe penetrates the profound Dharma,

original: the tshom las rgal ba /üîΩgzhan la ra ga ma las pa /
analyzed: the tshom las rgal ba / gzhan la ra ga ma las pa /
translated: he crosses over doubt, he crosses over uncertainty,

original: gzhan gyis kha drang du mi mi rung ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kha drang du mi mi rung ba /
translated: he does not depend on others in order to find certainty in the teaching of the Teacher,üîΩhe enters into the stage of certainty,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa dang chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob po zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa dang chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob po zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he obtains the fearlessnesses with regard to the teaching of the Teacher and with regard to the factors.

original: thog ma nyid du bden pa rnams las 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du bden pa rnams las 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig ste /
translated: The eye of the Dharma is the first pure praj√±ƒÅ, which is the seeing of the different natures of the factors.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of their very nature.

original: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis rdul med de @253b de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis rdul med de @253b de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the acceptances of Dharma are without dust, because they abandon the dust of the defilements.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bral ba ste de dag gi sgrib pa dang dri ma spangs pa de'i gnas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bral ba ste de dag gi sgrib pa dang dri ma spangs pa de'i gnas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledges of Dharma are stainless, because they are the state of the abandonment of the obscurations and stains of those acceptances.

original: chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyis chos mthong ba ste /
analyzed: chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyis chos mthong ba ste /
translated: The acceptances of Dharma are the seeing of Dharma,

original: de rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they realize reality.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis thob pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis thob pa ste /
translated: The knowledges of Dharma are the attainment,

original: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they manifest the liberation from the defilements.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rtogs pa ste /
translated: The subsequent acceptances are the realization of Dharma,

original: de rnams kyis 'phags pa'i chos rjes su rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'phags pa'i chos rjes su rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: because they are the realization of the noble Dharma.

original: de gnyi ga yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both of them are the realization of the correct understanding of that.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams kun nas brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams kun nas brtan pa yin no //
translated: The subsequent cognitions fully understand the dharmas.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las rgal ba ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las rgal ba ste /
translated: All the patiences and knowledges are beyond doubt,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu rtogs pa ni yun ring po nas brang pa rang gis rtogs pas the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu rtogs pa ni yun ring po nas brang pa rang gis rtogs pas the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realization of the result of the supramundane path is the realization by oneself of what has been sought for a long time, and so there is no doubt.

original: thams cad kyis the tshom las rgal ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyis the tshom las rgal ba ste /
translated: All of them are beyond doubt,

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa de'i gnas skabs na gzhan dag kyang khyad par rtogs pa la yid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa de'i gnas skabs na gzhan dag kyang khyad par rtogs pa la yid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the state of the realization of others, there is no doubt about the realization of the distinctions of others.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa ni lam bsgoms pa la gzhan gyi lung med kyang rang mkhas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa ni lam bsgoms pa la gzhan gyi lung med kyang rang mkhas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Not dependent on others means that in the cultivation of the path, one is not dependent on the instructions of others, because one is wise by oneself.

original: ; gzhan gyis kha drang du mi rung ba ni dad pa mi phyed pa thob pas so //
analyzed: ; gzhan gyis kha drang du mi rung ba ni dad pa mi phyed pa thob pas so //
translated: Not to be led by others means that one is not to be led by others, because one has attained undivided faith.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa ni gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan du yang mi phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa ni gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan du yang mi phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the Master is not to be taken away by others, because it is not taken away by other tirthikas in other lives.

original: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni rtogs pa las brtsams te dri ma dang lung bstan pa'i chos rnams la sdig pa 'dod pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni rtogs pa las brtsams te dri ma dang lung bstan pa'i chos rnams la sdig pa 'dod pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One obtains fearlessness in regard to all dharmas, because one is not discouraged in one's mind, like one who is proud of his sin, in regard to the dharmas of defilement and of prediction, beginning with realization.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgoms pa ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgoms pa ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: One cultivates the supramundane path in order to abandon the remaining defilements.

original: des ni bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'dod pa na spyod pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: des ni bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'dod pa na spyod pa bzhi ste /
translated: For, by that, one abandons the ten defilements that are to be abandoned by cultivation,

original: 'dod chags dang ; khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gsum gsum spong ngo //üîΩsdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa de dag nyid chos shes pa dang / rjes @254a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ; khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa khong khro ba ma gtogs pa gsum gsum spong ngo // sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa de dag nyid chos shes pa dang / rjes @254a * //
translated: four of which occur in the realm of desire: passion, hostility, pride, and ignorance; and three of which occur in the realms of form and the formless, excluding hostility.

original: su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Those knowledges of suffering, origin, cessation, and path are the sides of the knowledge of dharmas and subsequent knowledge.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi phyir ro //
translated: The concentration associated with it is the first meditation up to the base of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni 'jig rten pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni 'jig rten pa nyid de /
translated: The base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is only mundane.

original: 'du shes gsal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'du shes gsal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because perception is not clear in it.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis ji srid du 'du shes snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa bkag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis ji srid du 'du shes snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa bkag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúAs long as there is the meditative attainment of perception, there is the obstruction of complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gcig tu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis zhing gi khyad par la byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum ston te /üîΩbsod nams dag gi rnam smin bde //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis zhing gi khyad par la byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum ston te / bsod nams dag gi rnam smin bde //
translated: In one way, this verse shows the three kinds of effects of action in relation to the distinction of the field.

original: zhes bya bas ni yo byad kyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to /üîΩbsam pa yang dag 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni yo byad kyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to / bsam pa yang dag 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: The effect of the cause consisting of material goods is shown by the verse, ‚ÄúThe effect of merit is happiness.‚Äù

original: zhes bya bas ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to //
translated: The effect of the cause consisting of the fulfillment of wishes is shown by the verse, ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs wishes are fulfilled.‚ÄùüîΩThe effect of the cause consisting of the purification of the mental continuum is shown by the verse, ‚ÄúOne becomes a fit vessel for suffering and for the noble path.‚Äù

original: myur du byang chub dam pa dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: myur du byang chub dam pa dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: One quickly attains the highest enlightenment and the transcendence of suffering.

original: zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun zhing phul du byung bas byas pa'i chos dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun zhing phul du byung bas byas pa'i chos dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu ston to //
translated: This shows the result that arises from the cause of virtuous qualities, which is consistent with and conducive to the transcendence of suffering.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las bcu bzhi pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don bsdus pa las bcu bzhi pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
translated: This is the summary of the fourteenth chapter.

original: // / sbyin bas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: // / sbyin bas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: By generosity, merit increases.

original: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
analyzed: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
translated: By perfect restraint, one is not harmed by enemies.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
analyzed: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
translated: By virtue, one abandons evil.

original: nyon mongs zad pas mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pas mya ngan 'das //
translated: By exhausting afflictions, one attains nirvana.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the verse.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Blessed One speak this?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / lam rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas gsungs par mngon no //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / lam rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas gsungs par mngon no //
translated: It appears that he spoke this beginning with the three paths in order to demonstrate the qualities of generosity, morality, and wisdom.üîΩTherein,

original: de la ; sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: de la ; sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: By generosity, merit increases.

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This verse teaches the virtues of generosity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar bya ba nyid dang / bsod nams nye bar skye ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar bya ba nyid dang / bsod nams nye bar skye ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The seven bases of merit that arise from material generosity always and uninterruptedly increase merit and generate merit.

original: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
analyzed: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
translated: One is not harmed by enemies through right restraint.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This verse teaches the virtues of morality.

original: dgra mi sogs pa ni bzod pa yin la //
analyzed: dgra mi sogs pa ni bzod pa yin la //
translated: One is not harmed by enemies through morality,

original: tshul khrims ni bzod pa dang lhan @254b cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bzod pa dang lhan @254b cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because morality is the basis of patience.

original: lhag mas ni ye shes kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩmthong ba'i lam gyis /
analyzed: lhag mas ni ye shes kyi yon tan rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te / mthong ba'i lam gyis /
translated: The remaining verses teach the virtues of wisdom.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
analyzed: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
translated: One abandons evil through the path of insight.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad pa las legs par mya ngan 'das te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad pa las legs par mya ngan 'das te /
translated: One attains nirvana through the path of cultivation, by eliminating attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: mdor bsdus nas mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba bstan to //
translated: In brief, it shows the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes dag gi phan yon rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs par mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes dag gi phan yon rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs par mngon no //
translated: Thus, this verse appears to have been spoken in order to demonstrate the benefits of generosity, morality, and wisdom.

original: las rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod du 'gyur ba dang / bde 'gror 'gyur ba dang / ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro ldog par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod du 'gyur ba dang / bde 'gror 'gyur ba dang / ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro ldog par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Beginning with the three kinds of actions means beginning with the action that leads to wealth, the action that leads to good rebirth, and the action that leads to the cessation of bad and good rebirths.

original: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: By generosity, merit increases.

original: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod du 'gyur ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod du 'gyur ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
translated: This is the beginning of the path that leads to wealth.

original: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
analyzed: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
translated: By restraint, one is not harmed by enemies.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
translated: This is the beginning of the path that leads to good rebirth.

original: lhag ma ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror ldog par 'gyur ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror ldog par 'gyur ba'i lam las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The rest is the beginning of the path that leads to the cessation of bad and good rebirths.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zag bzhi'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi bstan pas yang dag pa'i lam rnam pa bzhi la sbyar ba'i phyir gsungs par mngon te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zag bzhi'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi bstan pas yang dag pa'i lam rnam pa bzhi la sbyar ba'i phyir gsungs par mngon te /
translated: Or else, it is stated in order to apply the four kinds of persons to the four kinds of right paths, by teaching the four kinds of benefits.

original: gang zag bzhi ni khyim pa dang ; rab tu byung ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag bzhi ni khyim pa dang ; rab tu byung ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of persons are householders, those gone forth, ordinary beings who have attained the aids to penetration, and those in training.

original: phan yon rnam pa bzhi ni 'phel ba'i phan yon dang / 'grib pa'i phan yon dang / gtong ba'i phan yon dang / rtogs pa'i phan yon te /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bzhi ni 'phel ba'i phan yon dang / 'grib pa'i phan yon dang / gtong ba'i phan yon dang / rtogs pa'i phan yon te /
translated: The four kinds of benefits are the benefit of increase, the benefit of decrease, the benefit of relinquishment, and the benefit of realization.

original: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: By giving, merit increases greatly

original: zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams kyi 'phel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams kyi 'phel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: is stated in order to teach the benefit of increase for householders.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa rnams ni sogs na bde'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim pa rnams ni sogs na bde'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, Householders are happy when they accumulate.

original: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
analyzed: yang dag sdom pas dgra mi sogs //
translated: By perfect restraint, one does not approach enemies

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'grib pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'grib pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: is stated in order to teach the benefit of decrease for those gone forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni 'grib na bde'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni 'grib na bde'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said: ‚ÄúMonks, it is good to be in a minority of one.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //

original: de gnyis kyi phyir 'di skad du /

translated: Those who are free from the distractions of fear of thieves and so on, and who have a sense of physical and mental security, are satisfied with food and drink that nourishes their bodies and minds.
